p: From the 2009-2010 season through the 2015-2016 season, 1 859 890 all-cause deaths, 566 475 underlying respiratory or circulatory deaths, and 77 850 underlying influenza or pneumonia deaths were observed ( Table 1). Deaths among those at least 65 years of age accounted for 72.3% (all-cause deaths), 85.3% (respiratory or circulatory deaths), and 92.5% (influenza or pneumonia deaths) of deaths.
